## PHQ-9 vs GAF

The process of comparing and matching items between different psychological instruments like the Patient Health Questionnaire (PHQ-9) and the Global Assessment of Functioning (GAF) is often tedious and time-consuming for psychologists. This necessitates the need for a tool such as Harmony. Harmony is geared towards simplifying the harmonisation process through its advanced AI system. With a database that includes PHQ-9 and GAF among many others, Harmony can instantly generate a percentage match between items in PHQ-9 vs GAF, reducing complexity and saving invaluable time. # Benefitting from Harmony in Comparing PHQ-9 vs GAF Harmony is a user-friendly tool. Its drag and drop interface allows for easy comparison of your own test instruments besides those available in its expansive database. When it comes to comparing PHQ-9 vs GAF, Harmony takes into account the various symptom ratings in GAF, alongside the specific depression symptoms outlined in PHQ-9, and then creates a reliable comparison report. Furthermore, Harmony even offers multilingual support enhancing its utility across different geographies and populations. # Encouraging Usage of Harmony for PHQ-9 vs GAF Comparisons With advanced natural language processing and generative AI models, Harmony brings a groundbreaking approach to the task of harmonising questionnaire items. Psychologists looking to compare PHQ-9 vs GAF can benefit enormously from this technology. By providing streamlined, objective comparisons, Harmony aids in making more accurate cross-study conclusions. Psychologists are highly encouraged to make use of Harmony's robust capabilities to facilitate their research and improve the efficiency of their PHQ-9 vs GAF comparisons.

## Compare the items in PHQ-9 and GAF

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just GAF into Harmony</a> - compare GAF with other instruments
